alert.note: Alert for Lancaster (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 26 at 2:46AM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occurring. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Nebraska, including the following county, Lancaster. * WHEN...Until 545 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 242 AM CDT, trained weather spotters reported heavy rain leading to street flooding in Lincoln. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lincoln, Holmes Lake Park, Lincoln Airport, Pioneers Park, Emerald, Walton, Denton and Yankee Hill Lake. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
